reviews.review_msg: Richard is an absolute joke. His rubric and instructions for the final are not clear whatsoever. He encourages people to answer questions, then blames us when we actually ask. He blabs about himself all the time and his lectures are so dry, it's actually painful. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

Not the best prof I've had. Lectures are useless, he goes on unnecessary tangents. Don't learn much in tutorials either. Average for midterm was really good, but he thought to make the final harder because he was concerned about how good the marks were. Uses various scare tactics to instill fear in the beginning of course. Solid person outside tho.

Richard is a nice and caring professor. I see why people are rating him low as he does tend to trail off the main points of his lecture and talks about his life stories, but honestly I dont mind, makes it more interesting. He gets everything straight from the textbook so as long as you read it and understand the theories you will be just fine.

Richard is a nice prof and cares for his students but his lectures are so boring. His slides are directly from the textbook and reads off them. He tells many stories of his past careers and sometimes they can trail on for a very long time. Lectures are basically useless and better off if you do them on your own.

Constantly talked about himself during lecture and 99% of the time it wasn't relevant (lowkey saviour complex). It's obvious there's no planning done in advanced because he reads the slides and makes something up. 
Exam wasn't challenging if you study using the textbook, lectures are useless. You don't receive any grades until the end of term.

Richard was a fun lecturer for this course, although at times it seemed like he would trail off on some tangents rather than lecturing on the slides. The textbook is your best friend for studying in this class.

Read and make notes on the textbook and you will be just fine. Lectures are basically useless unless you need an excuse to go to campus. Luckily i had a very lovely TA so tutorials were fine. However, if you need a engaging prof and don't do well with self-guided work, drop it. He reads directly from the textbook and shows he doesn't wanna be there

This class was not mandatory. The lectures are boring and you don't learn anything from them. The prof gets off topic and it is hard to focus. Tutorials were helpful if you get a good TA. Exams are not too difficult. Wish the prof made the class more engaging. You have 2 exams, a final paper, and tutorial participation. Rely on the textbook.

Richard is an ok professor. Lectures are not very engaging and not worth going to since you can learn everything from the textbook. Tutorials are like 10%, so be sure to attend those. The midterm and final are not difficult. The term paper can be frustrating and you're not really given proper guidance, but seek help from your TA.

BUY THE TEXTBOOK! Not even by midterm, half the class wouldn't show up because he reads right from the textbook. He seems like a cool guy but his lectures were boring and the textbook is an absolute necessity. Tests are online and easy if you keep up with the readings.

Professor Konarski spends at least 20 minutes on a single slide and is terrible at giving useful feedback. His instructions for the final term paper are so unclear, and he doesn't bother to clarify anything despite how many emails you send. Lecture slides aren't of much help, but I guess he's a somewhat chill professor.

In lecture he uses the online textbook provided slides and reads straight from the textbook. Not very engaging prof at all and you don't actually need to attend lecture as long as you keep up on your reading. meh.
Reads straight from the textbook so lectures are not mandatory. Midterm was very fair and easy. Not very much guidance on the final paper. If you read the textbook, the class will be easy.

The mid-term exam was not too bad but, the final exam was way different. Most students that got A's on the midterm got around 50% on the final. Does not give guidance on what to do for paper. Lectures are on news articles and is pushing his narrative and it does not relate to essay or exam questions. Very unclear in emails when asking questions.

He's a nice enough guy but knows nothing about how to run a class as an instructor. He talked a bit too much and went off topic a lot. He leaves no feedback. The worst part about his courses is that you have absolutely NO idea what grade you are standing at until the end of the semester, which by then is pretty much too late to make a difference.

CRIM 455- 20% Participation. 30% Presentation, and a 50% 20 page paper.  We did not use the textbook at all and each class was a discussion of a particular policing topic.  He brings in lots of guest speakers and is an overall fair marker. No tests, but a negative: you dont know any of your marks until after classes are done.

Lectures are interesting. He is very laid back. Looks like a skinnier dr. Phil. Had a take home midterm. Final was much harder than expected, too many short answers, not enough time. TA (Sarah P.) was awesome!! Overall... he's ok.

Konarski's a laid-back easy going guy but he's just a little off track most of the time. He tells great anecdotes but doesn't really relate it to subject materials. He wasn't helpful in telling students what the final was on. Lectures useless, but his TA posted all the notes on webct. Just study the notes mostly.
horrible prof! doesn't talk about the final exam.. too much discussion during lectures.. doesn't help with the final exam

Just a comment to everyone whining about the exams... they are only about memorization if you don't learn the material and understand it, just like any other class. Try reading your text and participating in the class discussions. Suck it up, you're not in high school anymore.

personal anecdotes are kinda funny to listen to, he has a sense of humor which is nice. the clarity wasnt always the best, and it was kind of boring at times.. but hey, you can't win em all.  a nice guy overall, not the best notes either.. but hey.
Terrible prof, he doesn't know jack about teaching, and he is certainly doesn't have a clue on how to teach a subjective field like Criminology. Memorize word-for-word or fail.
just study his notes for the exams cuz they are straight from the text. it's more about memorization than anything. great stories told during lectures cuz he's a cop.

Lecture and texts are wastes of time and money. He just pulls blocks directly from the text for lecture slides and uses exactly that for the exams, so get notes off a friend and save money and time on a text you really need. Refuses to tape lectures
Good Prof with a good teaching style.  He needs to learn how to right an exam that doesnt have vague open ended questions.

Really interesting prof because he has a personal story to back up everything we learn! Also very approachable, but the exams are kind of random, and more about memorization rather than understanding.
